# Model estimates

## Absolute Recruitment
```{r rec-abs, fig.height = 4, out.height = "80%"}

plot_recruitment(list(base_model),
                 list(base_model_name),
                 inc_means = TRUE,
                 leg_pos = "none") |>
  suppressWarnings()
```

## Spawning Biomass
```{r main-biomass, fig.height = 4, out.height = "80%"}

plot_biomass(list(base_model),
             list(base_model_name),
             ylim = c(0, 5),
             point_shape = ts_single_model_pointshape,
             leg_pos = "none")
```

## Relative Spawning Biomass
```{r main-rel-biomass, fig.height = 4, out.height = "70%"}

plot_rel_biomass(list(base_model),
                 list(base_model_name),
                 ylim = c(0, 2.5),
                 alpha = 0.2,
                 leg_pos = "none")
```

## Fishing intensity and exploitation rate
:::::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
<!-- \center Relative fishing intensity \center -->
```{r jmc-fishing-intensity-fig, fig.height = 4, fig.width = 4, out.height = "75%"}

plot_fishing_intensity(base_model,
                       line_width = 0.5,
                       point_size = 1.5,
                       point_stroke = 1,
                       fspr40_text_x = 1970) +
  theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size = 10),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = 10),
        axis.text.x = element_text(size = 8, angle = -35, vjust = 1.5, hjust = -0.2),
        legend.key.size = unit(0.5, units = "cm"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 10))
```

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
<!-- \center Exploitation rate \center -->
```{r jmc-exploitation-fraction-fig, fig.height = 4, fig.width = 4, out.height = "75%"}

plot_exploitation_fraction(base_model,
                           line_width = 0.5,
                           point_size = 1.5,
                           point_stroke = 1) +
  theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size = 10),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = 10),
        axis.text.x = element_text(size = 8, angle = -35, vjust = 1.5, hjust = -0.2),
        legend.key.size = unit(0.5, units = "cm"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 10))
```
